componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
IAP Eligibility Criteria

  • At least one of the following scenarios apply:
    • Product Acquisition Delay – Delay in obtaining product through Specialty Distributor that will cause the patient to experience a delay/lapse in therapy for a patient who is already on therapy with an established treatment cycle.
    • Change in Insurance Status (Patients transitioning to Commercial coverage only) – Patient has a change in insurance due to change in employment, marital or financial status and is awaiting a new plan to become effective (not to include patients transitioning from free drug programs). Benefit verification will be completed to attempt to verify the patient plan effective date. Review of coverage will be scheduled for plan effective date. If effective cannot be obtained, scheduled for first business day of following month.
    • Prior Authorization (PA)/Appeal Processing – Patient had a change in insurance and the new plan requires prior authorization approval prior to coverage being approved or. Prior authorization with the patient’s current plan has expired and the review/processing time for re-authorization will cause the patient to experience a delay/lapse in therapy or Patient has a change in insurance, the new plan denied prior authorization and the patient and/or HCP is actively appealing the decision. myRARE will assist with the prior authorization/appeal process as requested by the patient and/or HCP (SOP 1.03 Coverage Review and Support).
  • Must be a resident of US one of its possessions or territories
  • Treated by an HCP licensed in the US or Puerto Rico 
  • Use of EVKEEZA for on-label indication
  • Previously started EVKEEZA and was covered by insurance
  • Must not be inpatient. Patients who are hospitalized may not receive shipment during hospitalization. However, the program may coordinate shipment post discharge.
  • Patients experiencing a product acquisition delay may be enrolled in IAP for 1 month per scenario/occurrence of delay but may not exceed two occurrences in any 12-month period.
  • Insured patients experiencing a change in insurance and awaiting specified effective date may be enrolled in the program. Once the new insurance takes effect, the patient’s continued eligibility is dependent on actively seeking prior authorization approval.
  • Insured patients experiencing a change in insurance or going through a subsequent PA/appeal process that results in lapse of coverage may be enrolled in IAP for 1 month after a PA has been submitted.
    • If the PA approval process exceeds 1 month, a patient or HCP may provide proof of delay and receive an additional 1 month of eligibility.
    • If a PA is denied and requires an appeal, the patient’s eligibility may be extended for 3 months starting the date the appeal is submitted. The patient will not be eligible for the enrollment or extension until after the appeal has been submitted to the payer.
    • If the appeals process takes longer than the 3-month eligibility period, a patient or HCP may provide proof of delay and receive an additional 1 month of eligibility.
    • Patients may be eligible for IAP for a total of up to 6 months per lapse in coverage, or until a new coverage becomes effective and/or PA/Appeal has been approved, whichever occurs first.
    • The maximum 6-month eligibility period is applicable to each qualifying change in insurance or PA/appeal scenario.
    • Patients are eligible for multiple qualified enrollment periods throughout their ongoing therapy. 


For further details, reference SOP 1.06 Evinacumab Interim Access Program
